edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge
Class ZKFromSigmaProver

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge.ZKFromSigmaProver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ZKProver
public class ZKFromSigmaProver
extends java.lang.Object
implements ZKProver

Concrete implementation of Zero Knowledge prover.

This is a transformation that takes any Sigma protocol and any perfectly hiding commitment scheme and yields a zero-knowledge proof.

For more information see Protocol 6.5.1, page 161 of Hazay-Lindell.

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 2.1 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Method Detail

prove

public void prove(ZKProverInput input)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  CheatAttemptException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                  CommitValueException
Runs the prover side of the Zero Knowledge proof.

Let (a,e,z) denote the prover1, verifier challenge and prover2 messages of the sigma protocol.

This function computes the following calculations:

RUN the receiver in COMMIT.commit

COMPUTE the first message a in sigma, using (x,w) as input

SEND a to V

RUN the receiver in COMMIT.decommit

IF COMMIT.decommit returns some e

COMPUTE the response z to (a,e) according to sigma

SEND z to V

OUTPUT nothing

ELSE (IF COMMIT.decommit returns INVALID)

OUTPUT ERROR (CHEAT_ATTEMPT_BY_V)

Specified by:
prove in interface ZKProver
Parameters:
input - must be an instance of SigmaProverInput.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input is not an instance of SigmaProverInput
java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.
CheatAttemptException - if the challenge's length is not as expected.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was ap roblem in the serialization phase.
CommitValueException - can occur in case the commitment scheme is ElGamal.

processSecondMsg

public void processSecondMsg(byte[] e)
                      throws CheatAttemptException,
                             java.io.IOException
Processes the second message of the Zero Knowledge protocol: "COMPUTE the response z to (a,e) according to sigma SEND z to V OUTPUT nothing". This is a blocking function!

Throws:
CheatAttemptException - if the challenge's length is not as expected.
java.io.IOException - if failed to send the message.
